Package berlin.hu.cep.connector

Class MongoDBConnectConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • berlin.hu.cep.connector.ConnectorConfig
      • berlin.hu.cep.connector.MongoDBConnectConfig
  • public class MongoDBConnectConfig
extends ConnectorConfig
    A class to configure a MongoDBSinkConnector for Kafka Connect with sane defaults.

    The configuration is designed so that all communication between a Siddhi- and a Zeebe-instance is logged into a MongoDB database.

    An object of this class can be converted into a properties json file for the MongoDB Kafka Sink Connector via the Jackson ObjectMapper.
    Author:
    Lukas Gehring, Leon Haussknecht, Maurice Lindner, Jost Hermann Triller, Stefan Zabka
    See Also:
    MongoDB Kafka Sink Connector Documentation

    • Constructor Detail

      • MongoDBConnectConfig

        public MongoDBConnectConfig​(String connection_uri,
                            String topic,
                            String database,
                            String collection)
        Constructor for MongoDBConnectConfig. Note that since this class makes some assumptions not all configuration properties provided by the official MongoDBSinkConnector can be set here.
        Parameters:
        connection_uri - The uri of the MongoDB-instance.
        topic - The Kafka topic which should be logged in the database.
        database - The name of the database the sink writes to
        collection - MongoDB collection name to write to.
        See Also:
        MongoDB Kafka Sink Connector Properties

    • Method Detail

      • getTopics

        public String getTopics()
        The Topic is the Kafka topic name the connector listens to. This class is designed to listen to only one topic. The attribute is only named topics to be compatible with the official sink connector.
        Returns:
        the Kafka topic the connector listens to.

      • getConnection_uri

        public String getConnection_uri()
        The uri of the MongoDB instance.
        Returns:
        MongoDBuri to connect to.

      • getDatabase

        public String getDatabase()
        A MongoDBinstace has several databases it manages. Databases hold collection of (BSON)documents.
        Returns:
        The name of the MongoDBdatabase to log to.

      • getCollection

        public String getCollection()
        One MongoDB database holds several collections. A collections holds several (BSON)documents.
        Returns:
        MongoDBcollection to database to log to.
